intro: Capsella stenocarpa, commonly known as narrowpod chickweed, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Capsella stenocarpa is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
